intro: Ceropegia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Ceropegia madagascariensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
